scripts._comment: to use these scripts in the terminal use npm run <script-name>
scripts._comment2: after you run the playwright tests, run this command to generate/open the allure report, but it won't have the history of previous tests
scripts.generate-allure-report: npx allure generate ./allure-results --clean && npx allure open ./allure-report
scripts._comment3: preserving history in allure is a bit tricky, so I created a script to do that
scripts.start-tests-keep-allure-history: rm -rf ./allure-results && npx playwright test && cp -r ./allure-report/history ./allure-results/history && allure generate ./allure-results -o ./allure-report --clean && allure open ./allure-report

lint-staged._comment: I changed it so Prettier is now being handled by ESLint with eslint-plugin-prettier. Thats's why I removed (prettier --write) from lint-staged
